summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2-3, 2020, discussing the logistics of housing Ghislaine Maxwell following her arrest in New Hampshire. Officials from the Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office coordinate with the Bureau of Prisons and U.S. Marshals Service to arrange her transfer to the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, with emphasis on ensuring her safety due to the case's history.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; she was arrested in New Hampshire and officials are arranging her detention and transport to the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in New Hampshire and was expected to consent to detention pending transport to the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Virtual court presentation
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to be presented virtually in court at 3:30 PM on July 2, 2020.

events.title: Holiday weekend housing arrangements
events.description: Officials discussed housing Maxwell in a U.S. Marshals Service-contracted facility over the July 4th holiday weekend while finalizing her placement with the Bureau of Prisons.

locations: U.S. Customs House, 2nd and Chestnut Streets, Philadelphia, PA 19106
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in New Hampshire on July 2, 2020.
Officials expressed specific concern for Maxwell's safety due to 'the history here,' implying awareness of the high-profile and sensitive nature of the Epstein case.
The Bureau of Prisons was prepared to house Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as early as the week following her arrest.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY), the Bureau of Prisons, and the U.S. Marshals Service regarding her custody logistics.
A virtual court presentation for Maxwell was scheduled for 3:30 PM on the day of her arrest.
